file_content.text: I've just received a request for assistance from my colleague Major Damarus in Network Access. If you visit that sector, he could use you.
Always a pleasure to see you, my lord.
Good day, hunter.
Nice to see you, sir.
Hello. I trust you're doing well.
We found something interesting in Revan's complex, General.
Here is the secret Darth Revan was hiding from us in that complex.
I raided Darth Revan's complex. Here's what I found.
The operation in Darth Revan's complex was a success, General. Have a look at this.
What, that tiny speck was all you found in a vast complex?
Study that "speck" carefully, General. I think you'll find it useful... eventually.
It's enough.
Hmph. Not quite the prize I'd hoped for, but it's better than no prize at all.
It's only a fragment of a larger machine. The descendants of Revan's slaves are guarding it.
There was more.
There are still slaves living in there? Fascinating. Why didn't you wipe them out?
The mission didn't include exterminating slaves.
It wasn't my job.
Lesson learned. I should be more specific.
I thought diplomacy was called for when dealing with the holders of an unknown weapon.
I err on the side of caution.
These slaves may possess valuable information. No point in wasting them as a resource.
None of your business.
These aliens must be quite something if they convinced you to leave them alive.
While I'm not completely pleased with the results, you fulfilled your objectives. Thank you.
The slaves were all long dead. This was the only thing of interest left.
[Lie.] Yes, that's all.
Disappointing. If I didn't know better, I'd think someone else had beaten us to our prize.
I can't help feeling we're the victims of an awful joke. Apparently, Darth Revan had quite a sense of humor.
That sliver of machine is capable of generating food, clothing--even other machines.
That fragment is valuable.
Why didn't you say so before? This must be the mysterious cargo that Revan left behind.
I'll send the fragment to Dromund Kaas for study immediately, so we can master this technological marvel.
Darth Revan may have built the complex as a trap.
Or a devious mind.
If you're right, we should handle that fragment with care. It might be dangerous.
There's nothing more to be gained from Revan's complex.
[Lie.] Your work here is done.
I hope the Emperor isn't as disappointed as I am.
Regardless, you've risked your life to help my operation. I'm grateful.
I'll send the fragment to Dromund Kaas for study immediately.
It was a pleasure working with you.
Good luck.
From what I understand, it might be a while before that thing is useful.
Don't hold your breath.
Send me a holo if you do.
I can feel it humming with power. What is it? Some sort of device?
I found this machine with the descendants of Revan's alien slaves. It furnished everything they needed to survive.
Much more than that.
Including those impossible assassin droids and turrets, presumably.
The descendants of Revan's slaves were worshiping it. They called it their "Infinite Engine."
It's the Infinite Engine.
Fascinating. If Revan was hiding this, it must be astonishingly powerful.
Those descendants of Revan's slaves you mentioned--are the aliens still alive?
The ones I didn't kill won't survive without this machine.
They'll die off, eventually.
Excellent. I despise loose ends.
I don't know.
Not the ones I met.
Just as well--I doubt they'd be of any use to us.
Do I look like a scientist to you?
Find out for yourself.
Quite right--and I sense I'll have much to learn.
Was there anything else in the complex? Did you find evidence of Darth Revan's alien slaves?
The slaves' descendants were still alive, but I exterminated them.
Yes, but I killed them.
Ah, good. No loose ends, then.
Descendants of those slaves are still living in the complex.
They're still in there.
Troubling. If we're ordered to occupy the complex, I hope those vermin don't pose any problems.
[Lie.] What slaves?
They're probably long dead, anyway. This machine is our true prize.
The Emperor will be pleased. You've done a commendable job.
I'll have this machine transported to Dromund Kaas for study. With any luck, we can put it to good use.
I suspect that technology will be of great value to the Empire.
I hope so.
Goodbye.
Have fun with that.
Discover the secrets of Revan's facility and bring them to me.
Since you made this possible, it's only fair you be the first to explore Revan's complex.
Find out what happened to the alien slaves, recover Revan's mysterious cargo and return with your discoveries.
Don't you want to be part of this great discovery?
You're not coming?
I'd only get in your way.
This is a privilege.
Enough--I'm ready to leave.
With the reactors down, your job will be considerably less impossible than before. Good luck.
We dealt with the reactors, General. The defenses on Revan's complex are powerless.
I dealt with the reactors. Revan's complex is defenseless, General Kolvin.
I took down the reactors. Revan's complex doesn't have its fancy defenses.
The reactors powering Revan's complex are offline, General.
Magnificent. After all these years, we'll finally learn what secrets Revan left behind.
Revan's complex will remain a mystery until all the reactors are disabled.
General Kolvin? Agent Felth sent us.
Superb. You're precisely what I requested.
General Kolvin. I'm told you have a problem worthy of a Sith.
Woman named Felth sent me. Said you need a professional.
A colleague with Imperial Intelligence says you require assistance, General.
Yes, welcome. Glad to have someone of your talents here.
Welcome, all of you. I'm General Kolvin, mission leader here. I could use your assistance with a vital objective.
Welcome, my lord. I'm General Kolvin, the mission leader here. If you have a moment, I could use your assistance.
Your reputation precedes you, bounty hunter. General Kolvin, mission leader of this outpost. If you're seeking work, I have it.
I'm General Kolvin, this outpost's mission leader. If you have a moment, sir, I need your help with a priority alpha objective.
Good day. I'm General Kolvin, this outpost's mission leader. You're just what I've been looking for to achieve my objectives.
The Emperor has ordered me to unravel a great enigma in this sector: a complex constructed centuries ago by a Sith named Darth Revan.
Upon its completion, Revan sealed a mysterious cargo inside, along with many alien slaves. Nothing has exited--or entered--since.
The complex has sat for centuries, and no one's gotten inside?
How can that be?
Revan's security measures are... exhaustive, to say the least.
If nothing has come out, I'm guessing it's a tomb.
The slaves must be dead.
If so, it's the best-guarded tomb in the galaxy.
Make me care.
Whatever secrets the complex holds, they're valuable. I assume that interests you?
The complex is fortified with self-repairing, automated defense turrets and a seemingly inexhaustible supply of assassin droids. Amazing technology.
We've spent over a decade trying to breach those defenses--and failed.
Once I put my mind to something, nothing in the galaxy can stop me.
You're not trying hard enough.
Are you serious?
We lost over a thousand men until someone had the bright idea to send probe droids, instead. We've lost another ten thousand of those.
That's pathetic.
I've only recently taken command. My predecessors lacked, shall we say, insight.
I've discovered that the complex's defenses draw power from reactors across this sector. The owners of these reactors are completely unaware.
Unfortunately, they're also our enemies--Republic Special Forces, criminal cartels and mercenary armies. They'll never willingly shut down their reactors.
I will shut down these reactors and crush any opposition.
Then we do it the hard way.
You honor me, my lord.
Fortunately for you, manipulating power is one of my specialties.
Then we do it the hard way.
I bow before your superior cleverness, my lord.
Your enemies will find me very persuasive.
Then we do it the hard way.
I'm counting on it, my well-armed friend.
Willingness is irrelevant. They will submit, or fall.
Then we do it the hard way.
Our foes are well-armed and indisposed toward diplomacy. Hit them before they can hit back.
My assistance will cost you.
You'll be well-rewarded--and your role won't end with this task. Surely you're interested to see where this leads?
Finally accessing Revan's complex means shutting down every reactor powering its defenses. If even one remains active, we'll never make it inside. Good luck.
Enough. [Refuse quest]
Very well, then. Goodbye.
Sorry, I'm in conference with Dromund Kaas. Good day.
My colleague Major Damarus just transmitted a request for assistance in Network Access. If you're headed that way, you might check in on him.
